thread.title: JetBlue: "Free wifi for all in 2016"
thread.title_full: JetBlue: "Free wifi for all in 2016" | Buying Business Travel

title: JetBlue: "Free wifi for all in 2016"
text:
0 comments Gary Noakes Fri, 16 Oct 2015 12:21 Follow @BBT_online New York-based budget airline JetBlue will next autumn boast something its mainline rivals struggle to match – free wifi across its entire fleet.
The carrier has finished installing ‘Fly-Fi’ across its entire 150-strong Airbus A320 and A321 fleet and has now begun work on its Embraer E190 regional jets. All 60 of these are expected to fitted by autumn 2016.
JetBlue uses Ka-band satellite technology to provide broadband internet capable of streaming videos and using multiple devices at the same time. Wifi speeds of up to 20 mbps per device are promised. However, coverage is only guaranteed over the US.
Jamie Perry, JetBlue's vice president of brand and product development, said: "Soon every JetBlue customer will step onboard knowing their aircraft is equipped with free, fast internet and entertainment."
JetBlue is also preparing to launch unlimited, on-demand entertainment via on-board Amazon Video. This will allow Amazon Prime members instant streaming access movies and TV episodes in-flight, at no additional cost.
